alert.note: Alert for Chase; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Chase and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles west of Madison, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Chase and northwestern Greenwood Counties. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 103 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
